Highlights.content: History, mythology, literature and phylosophy are interconected
The Original Works are Surviving Artifacts
It starts at the flourishing of Greek civilization and ends with the decline of the Roman Empire Centuries V b.c. to IV c.e
It starts at the flourishing of Greek civilization and ends with the decline of the Roman Empire Centuries V b.c. to IV c.e

Works.Name: The Charioteer of Delphi
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Charioteer of Delphi is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Pottery of Musical Scenes
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Pottery of Musical Scenes is a Greek ceramic...

Works.Name: Discobolus of Myron
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Discobolus of Myron is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Doryphoros
Works.Author: Polykleitos
Works.Description: The Doryphoros by Polykleitos is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Parthenon
Works.Author: Ictinus, Callicrates, and Phidias
Works.Description: The Parthenon is a Doric temple dedicated to the goddess Athena...

Works.Name: Bronze of Riace
Works.Author: Phidias
Works.Description: The Bronze of Riace are two full-size Greek bronzes of naked bearded warriors...
Works.Museum: National Museum of Magna Graecia in Reggio Calabria

Works.Name: Bust of Plato
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A bust depicting the ancient Greek philosopher Plato, often considered a foundational figure in Western philosophy.

Works.Name: Hercules Farnese
Works.Author: Glykon of Athens
Works.Description: A Roman copy of a lost original by Lysippos, this sculpture depicts Hercules in a moment of rest, holding the apples of the Hesperides.

Works.Name: The Abduction of Proserpina
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sculpture depicting the mythological event of Hades abducting Persephone to be his queen in the underworld.

Works.Name: Bust of Aristotle
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sculptural portrait of Aristotle, one of the greatest philosophers in history, known for his influence on logical and scientific thought.

Works.Name: Helios Chariot
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A representation of the sun god Helios driving his chariot across the sky, symbolizing the passage of the sun found in Troy.

Works.Name: Alexander Sarcophagus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Alexander Sarcophagus is a late 4th century BC Hellenistic stone sarcophagus adorned with bas-relief carvings of Alexander the Great.

Works.Name: Winged Victory of Samothrace
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Winged Victory of Samothrace, also known as the Nike of Samothrace, is a marble Hellenistic sculpture of Nike, the Greek goddess of victory, discovered on the island of Samothrace in 1863.

Works.Name: Venus de Milo
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Venus de Milo is an ancient Greek statue and one of the most famous works of ancient Greek sculpture, representing Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and beauty.

Works.Name: Bust of Socrates
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bust of Socrates is a sculptural bust of Socrates, one of the founders of Western philosophy, known for his contributions to ethics and epistemology.

Works.Name: Young Hercules
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Young Hercules is a sculpture depicting a youthful Hercules, highlighting his strength and potential in his early years.

Works.Name: The Dying Gaul
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Dying Gaul is a Roman marble copy of a Hellenistic sculpture, portraying a wounded Gallic warrior in a moment of agony and defeat.

Works.Name: Young Woman with Stylus and Tablet
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco from Pompeii

Works.Name: The Punishment of Dirce
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: This dramatic fresco depicts the mythological punishment of Dirce, tied to a wild bull by the sons of Antiope as retribution for her cruelty.

Works.Name: Hercules and Omphale
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco showing Hercules in the service of Omphale, the Lydian queen, where he is often depicted

Works.Name: Helen of Sparta on Her Way to Troy
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco capturing the moment Helen of Sparta is taken to Troy, an event that sparked the Trojan War.

Works.Name: Fayum Portraits
Works.Author: Various
Works.Description: A collection of mummy portraits from the Fayum area in Egypt, remarkable for their realism and vivid depiction of ancient faces.

Works.Name: Dionysus with Helios, Aphrodite and Other Gods
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A detailed fresco depicting Dionysus alongside other deities such as Helios and Aphrodite, illustrating a scene of divine congregation.

Works.Name: Laocoon and His Sons
Works.Author: Agesander, Athenodoros, and Polydorus
Works.Description: This famous sculpture shows the Trojan priest Laocoon and his sons being attacked by sea serpents, highlighting the suffering and struggle.

Works.Name: Still Life with Eggs, Birds and Bronze Dishes
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: This fresco illustrates a still life scene with eggs, birds, and ornate bronze dishes, showcasing Roman daily life and luxury.

Works.Name: Colosseum
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The iconic Colosseum, a monumental amphitheatre in the center of Rome, known for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

Works.Name: House of Venus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco from the House of Venus in Pompeii depicting the goddess Venus, showcasing the artistic elegance and detailed craftsmanship of Roman frescoes.

Works.Name: Relief of the Judgment of Paris
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A marble relief depicting the mythological story of the Judgment of Paris, where Paris is tasked with selecting the most beautiful goddess leading to the events of the Trojan War.

Works.Name: Jupiter of Smyrna
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A grand statue of Zeus (Jupiter), originally from Smyrna, representing the king of the gods in classical mythology, noted for its imposing size and regal posture.

Works.Name: Augustus of Prima Porta
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A statue of Emperor Augustus, housed in the Vatican's Pio-Clementine Museum, showcasing Augustan propaganda through art.

Works.Name: Venus of Syracuse
Works.Author: Praxiteles
Works.Description: Attributed to the famed sculptor Praxiteles, this statue is a celebrated depiction of Aphrodite, highlighting classical Greek beauty and divinity.

Works.Name: Trajan's Column
Works.Author: Apollodorus of Damascus
Works.Description: A monumental column in Rome celebrating Emperor Trajan's victory in the Dacian Wars, famous for its spiral bas relief, which narrates the wars' history.

Works.Name: Sarcophagus of the Twelve Labors of Hercules
Works.Author: Genzano
Works.Description: A sarcophagus intricately carved with scenes from the twelve labors of Hercules, showcasing the hero's strength and divine challenges.

Works.Name: Sarcophagus of the Passion of Christ
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sarcophagus depicting the Passion of Christ.

Works.Name: Sarcophagus of Junius Bassus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sarcophagus belonging to Junius Bassus.

Works.Name: Apse of the Basilica of Santa Prudenciana
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The apse of the Basilica of Santa Prudenciana.

Works.Name: Pantocrator of Sinai
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A depiction of the Pantocrator from the Monastery of Saint Catherine.
Works.Museum: Monastery of Saint Catherine, Mount Sinai, Egypt

Works.Name: Monogram of the Incarnation (Book of Kells)
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A page from the Book of Kells showing the Monogram of the Incarnation.

Works.Name: Church of San Martín
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A Romanesque church located in Segovia, Spain.

Works.Name: Pantocrator of the Apse of San Clemente de Tahull
Works.Author: Master of Tahull
Works.Description: A famous Romanesque fresco located in the apse of San Clemente de Tahull.
Works.Museum: National Art Museum of Catalonia (MNAC), Barcelona

Works.Name: Frontal of La Seo de Urgel
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A Romanesque altarpiece from La Seo de Urgel.
Works.Museum: National Art Museum of Catalonia (MNAC), Barcelona

Works.Name: Judith and Holofernes on an Ivory Piece from the Trictrac Board Game
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: An ivory piece depicting Judith and Holofernes from the Trictrac board game.

Works.Name: Baldachin of Tost
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A Romanesque baldachin from the Tost region.
Works.Museum: National Art Museum of Catalonia (MNAC), Barcelona

Works.Name: Cathedral of Santa María de León
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A Gothic cathedral located in León, Spain.

Works.Name: Illustrated Bible of The Hague
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: An illustrated Bible from The Hague.

Works.Name: Altar Frontal of Mosoll
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A Gothic altarpiece from Mosoll.
Works.Museum: National Art Museum of Catalonia (MNAC), Barcelona

Works.Name: The Expulsion of Joachim from the Temple
Works.Author: Giotto
Works.Description: A fresco depicting the expulsion of Joachim from the temple.
Works.Museum: Scrovegni Chapel, Civic Museum of Padua, Italy

Works.Name: Adoration of the Magi
Works.Author: Giotto
Works.Description: A painting depicting the Adoration of the Magi.

Works.Name: Maestà
Works.Author: Duccio di Buoninsegna
Works.Description: A large altarpiece painted by Duccio di Buoninsegna.

Works.Name: Mosaics of the Church of Kahrié-Djami
Works.Author: Master of the Church of Kahrié-Djami
Works.Description: Mosaics located in the Church of the Holy Savior in Chora.
Works.Museum: Church of the Holy Savior in Chora, Istanbul

Works.Name: Book of the City of Ladies
Works.Author: Christine de Pizan
Works.Description: A famous work by Christine de Pizan.

Works.Name: Christine de Pizan and Her Son
Works.Author: Bedford Master
Works.Description: A manuscript depicting Christine de Pizan and her son.

Works.Name: The Descent from the Cross
Works.Author: Rogier van der Weyden
Works.Description: A painting depicting the descent of Christ from the cross.

Works.Name: Annunciation
Works.Author: Fra Angelico
Works.Description: A painting depicting the Annunciation.

Works.Name: Charlemagne at Dinner
Works.Author: Talbot Master
Works.Description: A depiction of Charlemagne at dinner.

Works.Name: Jean Miélot at His Desk
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A depiction of Jean Miélot at his desk.

Works.Name: Resurrection
Works.Author: Hans Memling
Works.Description: A painting depicting the Resurrection of Christ.

Works.Name: Charlemagne and Pope Adrian
Works.Author: Antoine Vérard
Works.Description: A depiction of Charlemagne and Pope Adrian.

Works.Name: Early 16th Century French Printing
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: An early French printing from the 16th century.

Works.Name: Ten Books on Architecture
Works.Author: Vitruvius
Works.Description: A seminal work on architecture from the Roman architect Vitruvius.

Works.Name: Portrait of Pope Nicholas IV
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A portrait of Pope Nicholas IV from the early Renaissance period.

Works.Name: The Pietà
Works.Author: Michelangelo Buonarroti
Works.Description: A depiction of the Virgin Mary holding the dead body of Jesus Christ.

Works.Name: Head of a Girl
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: A drawing of a young girl's head by Leonardo da Vinci.

Works.Name: The Return of Judith to Bethulia
Works.Author: Sandro Botticelli
Works.Description: A painting depicting Judith returning to Bethulia after beheading Holofernes.

Works.Name: Polyptych of Saint Gregory
Works.Author: Antonello da Messina
Works.Description: A multi-panel painting by Antonello da Messina.

Works.Name: Hercules and the Hydra
Works.Author: Antonio del Pollaiolo
Works.Description: A painting depicting the mythological battle between Hercules and the Hydra.

Works.Name: The Adoration of the Magi
Works.Author: Sandro Botticelli
Works.Description: A painting depicting the adoration of the Magi.

Works.Name: The Birth of Venus
Works.Author: Sandro Botticelli
Works.Description: A painting depicting the goddess Venus emerging from the sea.

Works.Name: The Judgment of Paris
Works.Author: Workshop of Botticelli
Works.Description: A painting depicting the mythological judgment of Paris.

Works.Name: Lady with an Ermine
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: A portrait of a young woman holding an ermine.

Works.Name: Diary of Leonardo da Vinci: Hemisection of a Man and a Woman in the Act of Coitus
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: An anatomical drawing by Leonardo da Vinci.

Works.Name: Diary of Leonardo da Vinci: Sketch of a Snail Shell
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: A sketch of a snail shell by Leonardo da Vinci.

Works.Name: Songbook of Elvas Romances - Cabalgada de Peranzules
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A collection of romances from the Elvas Songbook.
Works.Museum: Public Library Publia Hortensia, Elvas, Portugal

Works.Name: Judith with the Head of Holofernes
Works.Author: Hartmann Schedel
Works.Description: An illustration depicting Judith holding the head of Holofernes.

Works.Name: Vitruvian Man
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: A drawing depicting the ideal human proportions.

Works.Name: Diary of Leonardo da Vinci: Anatomical Studies
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: Anatomical studies by Leonardo da Vinci.

Works.Name: The Last Supper
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Description: A mural painting depicting Jesus and his disciples at the Last Supper.

Works.Name: Mystic Nativity
Works.Author: Sandro Botticelli
Works.Description: A painting depicting the nativity scene.

Works.Description: A triptych painting depicting a surreal landscape.

Works.Description: An engraving on a coin depicting the judgment of Paris.

Works.Author: Raphael

Works.Name: Madonna Tempi
Works.Author: Raphael
Works.Description: A painting of the Madonna with the Child.

Works.Name: The Creation of Adam
Works.Author: Michelangelo
Works.Description: A fresco depicting God giving life to Adam.

Works.Name: The School of Athens
Works.Author: Raphael
Works.Description: A fresco depicting various classical philosophers.

Works.Name: Diary of Leonardo da Vinci: Educational Resource for Surgeons. Sketch of the Human Brain and Skull
Works.Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Works.Name: Libyan Sibyl
Works.Author: Michelangelo
Works.Description: A fresco depicting the Libyan Sibyl.

Works.Name: Portrait of Leonardo da Vinci
Works.Author: Attributed to Francesco Melzi
Works.Description: A portrait of Leonardo da Vinci.

Works.Name: Sistine Madonna
Works.Author: Raphael
Works.Description: A painting depicting the Madonna holding the Christ child.

Works.Name: The Charge to Peter
Works.Author: Raphael
Works.Description: A painting depicting Jesus giving the keys to Peter.

Works.Author: Raphael
